channel.title: Home on Boris Gailleton
channel.description: Recent content in Home on Boris Gailleton

item.title: CNES-Funded Flood Risk at Scale
item.description: Anticipating flood induced morphological damages from high-resolution topography

item.title: Hydrodynamics
item.description: WebGL Lisflood sandbox for testing shallow-water responses straight in the browser.

item.title: LSDTopoTools / lsdtopytools
item.description: Topographic analysis in c++ and python

item.title: Tectonic Geomorphology
item.description: Unraveling tectonics from the shape of the topography

item.title: TopoToolbox
item.description: EU-wide consortium for topographic analysis, morphometry and landscape evolution in C/python/R/…

item.title: Large-Scale Hydro-Morphodynamics
item.description: Integrating shor-term and local hydraulic and morphodynamic processes to the regional and geological scales

item.title: Landscape Evolution Models
item.description: Long-horizon experiments that keep FastScape, pyFastFlow, and their companions honest against observed reorganizations.

item.title: FastScape
item.description: Landscape evolution at geological time scales.

item.title: Scabbard / DAGGER
item.description: My own sandbox in c++/python. I keep it for legacy and reproducing paper results.

item.title: GraphFlood CPU Tutorial
item.description: How to drive the stationary GraphFlood solver via pytopotoolbox.

item.title: GraphFlood GPU Tutorial
item.description: pyfastflow setup for GPU-driven GraphFlood runs.

item.title: CV en Fran√ßais
item.description:
Poste actuel

  • Chercheur post-doctorant ‚Äî G√©osciences Rennes, Universit√© de Rennes (Rennes, France ¬∑ juil. 2022 ‚Äì pr√©sent)
    Analyses morphom√©triques inform√©es par l‚Äôhydrodynamique, couplages morphodynamique‚Äìhydrodynamique, d√©veloppement d‚Äôoutils communautaires (GraphFlood, scabbard, libtopotoolbox) et encadrement d‚Äô√©tudiant¬∑es de master et doctorant¬∑es.

Postes pass√©s

  • Chercheur post-doctorant ‚Äî GFZ Helmholtz Centre (Erdoberfl√§chenprozessmodellierung) ¬∑ Potsdam, Allemagne ¬∑ juin 2020 ‚Äì juin 2022
    Mod√©lisation num√©rique de paysages et syst√®mes source-to-sink, suivi de flux s√©dimentaire en pr√©sence de lacs et d‚Äôh√©t√©rog√©n√©it√©s de processus de surface, contributions majeures √† LSDTopoTools, fastscapelib et CHONK.
  • Ing√©nieur de recherche ‚Äî University of Edinburgh / Telespazio Vega ¬∑ Edinburgh, UK ¬∑ jan. 2019 ‚Äì nov. 2019
    Pr√©vision de glissements de terrain via l‚Äôint√©gration de mod√®les num√©riques et de donn√©es InSAR ; d√©veloppement et d√©ploiement de code C++ et Python.
  • Ing√©nieur de recherche ‚Äî Arcelor Mittal ¬∑ Maizi√®re-l√®s-Metz, France ¬∑ 2015
    Analyses de laboratoire (FTIR, MEB, microscope optique, XRF) et synth√®ses sur les gisements BIF.

Formation

  • Th√®se de doctorat en Sciences de la Terre ‚Äî University of Edinburgh ¬∑ sept. 2016 ‚Äì juin 2020
    M√©thodes num√©riques pour extraire les signaux tectoniques √† partir de MNT, campagnes de terrain (√©chantillons cosmog√©niques, mesures de r√©sistance in situ) et d√©veloppement de LSDTopoTools.
  • Master II G√©ologie mini√®re ‚Äî LaSalle Beauvais & Universit√© Laurentienne de Sudbury ¬∑ 2010 ‚Äì 2014
    Parcours Licence en g√©ologie puis sp√©cialisation en g√©ologie mini√®re entre Beauvais (FR) et Sudbury (CA).

Publications r√©centes

  • Tzathas, P., Gailleton, B., Steer, P. & Cordonnier, G. (2024). Physically-based analytical erosion for fast terrain generation. Computer Graphics Forum, 43, e15033.
  • Ruiz S√°nchez-Oro, M., Mudd, S. M. & Gailleton, B. (2024). Using disorder metrics to distinguish discharge-driven from drainage area-driven incision. JGR: Earth Surface, 129, e2023JF007553.
  • Oryan, B. et al. (2024). Megathrust locking encoded in subduction landscapes. Science Advances, 10, eadl4286.
  • Gailleton, B., Steer, P., Davy, P., Schwanghart, W. & Bernard, T. (2024). GraphFlood 1.0: an efficient algorithm to approximate 2D hydrodynamics for landscape evolution models. Earth Surface Dynamics, 12, 1295‚Äì1313.
  • Gailleton, B., Malatesta, L. C., Cordonnier, G. & Braun, J. (2024). CHONK 1.0: landscape evolution framework. Geoscientific Model Development, 17, 71‚Äì90.
  • Aminov, J., Dupont-Nivet, G., Ruiz, D. & Gailleton, B. (2023). Terra Antiqua plugin. Earth-Science Reviews, 240, 104401.

Logiciels de recherche

  • GraphFlood 1.0 (2024) ‚Äî code de support sur Zenodo (doi:10.5281/zenodo.11065794).
  • CHONK 1.0 (2023) ‚Äî framework paysage m√™lant automates cellulaires et th√©orie des graphes.
  • LSDTopoTools2 / LSDMappingTools (2018‚Äì2023) ‚Äî co-d√©veloppement et releases Zenodo.
  • lsdtopytools, lsdfailtools, fastscape-litho (2021) ‚Äî outils Python pour l‚Äôanalyse topographique.
  • xarray-simlab 0.5.0 (2021) ‚Äî co-auteur du framework de mod√©lisation modulaire.

Communications & diffusion

  • Articles grand public : System Erde 11(2), 36‚Äì41 (2021) ; Nature Reviews Earth & Environment 2, 161 (2021).
  • 24 r√©sum√©s soumis √† l‚ÄôEGU, l‚ÄôAGU et la RST ; 6 sessions co-organis√©es ; 1 conf√©rence invit√©e (Geomod 2023).
  • D√©p√¥ts de preprints : EarthArXiv (2024), ESSOAr (2020).

Conf√©rences (s√©lection)

  • EGU25 (2025) ‚Äî Nativ et al., Inverting the friction coefficient of heterogeneous riverbeds.
  • RST 2023 ‚Äî Gailleton et al., GraphFlood: un algorithme efficace pour simuler l’hydrodynamisme.
  • AGU 2024 ‚Äî Oryan, Gailleton et al., Subduction sculpting when megathrusts sleep.
  • AGU 2020 ‚Äî Gailleton et al., Lagrangian framework to simulate landscapes with local sinks.

Coordonn√©es

  • üìç UMR 6118 G√©osciences Rennes, Universit√© de Rennes
  • ‚úâÔ∏è boris.gailleton@univ-rennes.fr
  • üåê www.bgailleton.github.io ¬∑ GitHub bgailleton ¬∑ Scholar Boris Gailleton

item.title: English CV
item.description:
Current Position

  • Postdoctoral Researcher ‚Äî G√©osciences Rennes, University of Rennes (Rennes, France ¬∑ Jul 2022 ‚Äì present)
    Hydrodynamics-aware geomorphic analysis, coupled morphodynamic‚Äìhydrodynamic modelling, open-source tooling (GraphFlood, scabbard, libtopotoolbox) and supervision of MSc/PhD projects.

Previous Roles

  • Postdoctoral Researcher ‚Äî GFZ German Research Centre for Geosciences (Erdoberfl√§chenprozessmodellierung) ¬∑ Potsdam, Germany ¬∑ Jun 2020 ‚Äì Jun 2022
    Landscape-evolution and source-to-sink modelling, sediment routing across lakes and heterogeneous surface processes, major contributions to LSDTopoTools, fastscapelib and CHONK.
  • Research Engineer ‚Äî University of Edinburgh / Telespazio Vega ¬∑ Edinburgh, UK ¬∑ Jan 2019 ‚Äì Nov 2019
    Landslide prediction by linking numerical models with InSAR datasets; delivery of production-grade C++ and Python pipelines.
  • Research Engineer ‚Äî Arcelor Mittal ¬∑ Maizi√®re-l√®s-Metz, France ¬∑ 2015
    Laboratory analytics (FTIR, SEM, optical microscopy, XRF) and synthesis on banded iron formation deposits.

Education

  • PhD in Earth Sciences ‚Äî University of Edinburgh ¬∑ Sep 2016 ‚Äì Jun 2020
    Numerical methods for extracting tectonic signals from DEMs, field surveys for cosmogenic sampling and rock-strength testing, extension of LSDTopoTools.
  • MSc (Mining Geology) ‚Äî LaSalle Beauvais & Laurentian University (Sudbury) ¬∑ 2010 ‚Äì 2014
    Combined BSc in Geology with a joint French‚ÄìCanadian MSc focused on economic geology.

Selected Publications

  • Tzathas, P., Gailleton, B., Steer, P. & Cordonnier, G. (2024). Physically-based analytical erosion for fast terrain generation. Computer Graphics Forum, 43, e15033.
  • Ruiz S√°nchez-Oro, M., Mudd, S. M. & Gailleton, B. (2024). Using disorder metrics to distinguish discharge-driven from drainage area-driven incision. JGR: Earth Surface, 129, e2023JF007553.
  • Oryan, B. et al. (2024). Megathrust locking encoded in subduction landscapes. Science Advances, 10, eadl4286.
  • Gailleton, B., Steer, P., Davy, P., Schwanghart, W. & Bernard, T. (2024). GraphFlood 1.0: an efficient algorithm to approximate 2D hydrodynamics for landscape evolution models. Earth Surface Dynamics, 12, 1295‚Äì1313.
  • Gailleton, B., Malatesta, L. C., Cordonnier, G. & Braun, J. (2024). CHONK 1.0: landscape evolution framework. Geoscientific Model Development, 17, 71‚Äì90.
  • Aminov, J., Dupont-Nivet, G., Ruiz, D. & Gailleton, B. (2023). Terra Antiqua plugin for QGIS. Earth-Science Reviews, 240, 104401.

Research Software

  • GraphFlood 1.0 (2024) ‚Äî supporting code on Zenodo (doi:10.5281/zenodo.11065794).
  • CHONK 1.0 (2023) ‚Äî landscape evolution framework combining cellular automata and graph theory.
  • LSDTopoTools2 / LSDMappingTools (2018‚Äì2023) ‚Äî co-maintained releases on Zenodo.
  • fastscape-litho, lsdtopytools, lsdfailtools (2021) ‚Äî open-source packages for topographic analysis.
  • xarray-simlab 0.5.0 (2021) ‚Äî co-author of the modular modelling toolkit.

Outreach, Talks & Service

  • 24 abstracts submitted to EGU, AGU and RST; six session-chair roles; invited talk at Geomod 2023.
  • Public-facing pieces in System Erde 11(2), 36‚Äì41 (2021) and Nature Reviews Earth & Environment 2, 161 (2021).
  • Preprints released on EarthArXiv (2024) and ESSOAr (2020).

Recent Conferences

  • EGU25 (2025) ‚Äî Nativ et al., Inverting the friction coefficient of heterogeneous riverbeds using 2D hydraulic simulations.
  • AGU 2024 ‚Äî Oryan, Gailleton et al., Subduction sculpting when megathrusts sleep.
  • RST 2023 ‚Äî Gailleton et al., GraphFlood: un algorithme efficace pour simuler l’hydrodynamisme.
  • AGU 2020 ‚Äî Gailleton et al., Lagrangian framework to simulate landscapes with local sinks.

Contact

  • üìç UMR 6118 G√©osciences Rennes, Universit√© de Rennes
  • ‚úâÔ∏è boris.gailleton@univ-rennes.fr
  • üåê www.bgailleton.github.io ¬∑ GitHub bgailleton ¬∑ Scholar profile Boris Gailleton
